full_summary:
**Cloud Operations Support Strategy**
======================================

**Reference Information**
------------------------

* Ref. Number: CB-4661-24026213
* Amendment No.: 1
* Solicitation Number: 21120-24-4379183
* Publication Date: April 11, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: April 13, 2023 at 2:00 PM
* Amendment Date: April 13, 2023

**Procurement Details**
-----------------------

This RFP is for the provision of cloud operations support services to the Correctional Service Canada (CSC). The proposed period of contract is estimated to be 45.6 weeks, from the date of contract award to the completion of the contract.

The estimated level of effort is 1,710 hours (228 days).

The contract will be awarded through a selective tendering process, where the CSC has invited 15 supply arrangement holders to submit a proposal. The selected vendor will provide support services for Microsoft Azure Cloud expertise, including:

* Configuration and deployment of infrastructure as code (IaC) objects
* Contribution to developing migration plans to cloud solutions
* Contribution to strategy and roadmap for departmental migration to recommended Azure cloud services environments
* Technical advice and guidance to management and clients
* Participation in discussions/meetings/working groups with CSC stakeholders
* Assist Cloud Operations team in ingesting and correlating telemetry from on-prem and cloud devices
* Assist Cloud OPS team with the architecture, design, and implementation of data loss prevention and compliance policies

**Security Requirements**
-------------------------

The resources required for this contract must meet a minimum security level of Secret.

**Appendix**
-------------

The following documents are annexed to this RFP:

* Request for Proposal (RFP) 21120-24-4379183
* Proposed Period of Contract

**Trade Agreements**
------------------

This RFP is subject to various trade agreements, including Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and others.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For more information, please contact Stéphanie Gigoux at [stephanie.gigoux@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:stephanie.gigoux@csc-scc.gc.ca), (613) 791-3860.

Note:
* The Temporary Help Services (THS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles.
* Interested vendors should refer to the Trade Agreements section for details
